Class Base4Calc

  • java.lang.Object
    • Base4Calc

  • public class Base4Calc
extends java.lang.Object
    Base4Calc class defines the logic behind our calculator. It is responsible for handling base conversions and mathematical operations.
    Version:
    0.8.7

    Field Variables:

    • base : an integer variable pertaining to the number base the calculator is operating in
    • base10 : constant int variable to represent base 10 for simplified operation purposes
    • input : integer version of string to be read in and converted into/out of base 10.
    • output : integer keeping track of current total (result)

    Author:
    zhi/N. Willis
    See Also:
    clear(), sum(String), subtract(String), multiply(String), divide(String), equate(), setBase(int), setCurr(String), base10in(String), base10out(String)

      private int base10 
      private int input 
      private int output 
      (package private) java.lang.String result

      Constructor and Description
      Base4Calc()
      Constructor: initializes result field variable to "0";

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      (package private) int base10in(java.lang.String s)
      method: base10in takes a string as parameter.
      (package private) int base10out(java.lang.String s)
      method: base10out takes a string as parameter.
      (package private) void clear()
      method: clear takes not parameter.
      (package private) void divide(java.lang.String A)
      method: divide takes a string as parameter and uses the 2 helper methods to convert the string to an integer in base 10 divides the current value of output by it then convert said output back to the appropriate base.
      java.lang.String equate() 
      (package private) void multiply(java.lang.String A)
      method: multiply takes a string as parameter and uses the 2 helper methods to convert the string to an integer in base 10 multiply the current value of output by it then convert said output back to the appropriate base.
      (package private) void setBase(int b)
      method: setBase takes an int parameter and sets the current base to that value when called
      (package private) void setCurr(java.lang.String A)
      method: setCurr takes a string as parameter and converts it to an Integer in the current base
      (package private) void subtract(java.lang.String A)
      method: subtract takes a string as parameter and uses the 2 helper methods to convert the string to an integer in base 10 find the difference between the current value of output and said integer then convert output back to the appropriate base.
      (package private) void sum(java.lang.String A)
      method: sum takes a string as parameter and uses the 2 helper methods to convert the string to an integer in base 10 add it to the current value of output then convert said output back to the appropriate base.

        Parameters:

      • base10in

        int base10in(java.lang.String s)
        method: base10in takes a string as parameter. using the parseInt method from the Integer class/wrapper the string is read into an int in the appropriate base. The int is then converted to base 10 and then cast back to (and returned as) a string.
        Parameters:
        s - of type String
        Returns:
        base 10 version of input string

      • base10out

        int base10out(java.lang.String s)
        method: base10out takes a string as parameter. using the parseInt method from the Integer class/wrapper the string is read into an int in base10 The int is then converted to a different base and then cast back to (and returned as) a string.
        Parameters:
        s - of type String
        Returns:
        input integer in original base
